Package color

package color

Provides an implementation of the generic interface Category instantiated with the class Color, which incorporates the tools to create a category in which objects are colors (of class Color) and morphisms between two colors are represented by arrows of the average color. 

Class ColorUtil supplies the methods for converting colors between the RGB and YUV encoding systems through the use of these specific formulas:

R = Y + V * ((1-Wr)/Vmax);
G = Y - U * ((Wb * (1-Wb))/(Umax * Wg)) - v * ((Wr * (1-Wr))/(Vmax*Wg));
B = Y + U * ((1 - Wb)/Umax);

(where Wr, Wg, Wb, Vmax, Umax are given constants)

In both standards a color is described by three values:
- In RGB these values encode the amounts of red green and blue in the pixel, and they inherently contain information about the brightness (if we increase any one of them we move closer to white). 

- In YUV overall brightness (Y component) of each pixel is encoded separately from the color information (U (blue) and V (red) components).
A color is its U and V coordinates on the chrominance plane for a given Y. 

Since human sight is much more sensitive to different levels of brightness than it is to differences in color, reducing the color detail of an image without compromising the brightness can generate an image that looks just as good to the human eye but contains less data. 
Converting an RGB image to YUV is therefore one of the first steps in JPEG image compression. 

However, to be displayed on screen the color needs to be converted back to RGB format.
  • Class Summary
    Class
    Description
    Color
    Color is a class for creating color objects, whose fields include the three RGB values (that are passed to the constructor) and the YUV tuple (obtained by conversion).
    Colors
    Implementation of the generic interface Category instantiated with the class Color.  Provides the tools to create a category in which objects are colors and morphisms between two colors represent the average color. 
    ColorTest
    Creates a random Colors category, prints every object's and morphism's YUV and RGB component and saves it in a file using methods provided by class Colors.
    ColorUtil
    Provides some useful methods to work with colors and switch their components between the RGB and the YUV encoding system through the use of specific formulas and constants, find the average between two colors, find a color given another color and their average.
    ImageFileGenerator
